thread.title: Sunny, calm, warm conditions for the start of winter - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: Sunny, calm, warm conditions for the start of winter - NewsBreak

author: Tirza Ortiz
title: Sunny, calm, warm conditions for the start of winter - NewsBreak
text:
By Tirza Ortiz No media credit provided. ,
51 minutes ago EL PASO, Texas ( KTSM ) — Happy Thursday, Borderland! Today was very similar to the days prior, and it appears this trend is going to continue moving into next week.
Tonight, expect mostly clear skies and a low in the mid-40s. Winds will continue to blow calm around 5-10 mph.
Friday is looking to be another beautiful day with plenty of sunshine and blue skies. The high will be in the low to mid 70s with calm breezes in the afternoon. The low will be in the upper 40s.
At this time, Saturday is looking to be the warmest day in the forecast period with a high in the upper 70s. The low will be in the mid-40s.
Sunday through Saturday are so far showing highs in the low 70s with mostly sunny skies – minus Tuesday and Wednesday – where more cloud cover is expected. Lows will continue to track in the mid to upper 40s.
Christmas Day is so far looking comfortable. The morning will be mild with the early morning hours in the 40s and the high in the low 70s.
